title: How to Install the Ika typescript SDK

content: How to Install the Ika typescript SDKHenÃ¸ch1 min readÂ·Just now--ListenSharePress enter or click to view image in full sizePrerequisite: Install Sui on your local systemâ€Šâ€”â€Šthe command-line interface for interacting with the Sui blockchain.1)To use the Ika TypeScript SDK from the repository, you have to clone the repository and install the dependencies:git clone https://github.com/dwallet-labs/ika.gitAdd this to your package.json file.{  "dependencies": {    "@ika.xyz/sdk": "file:../sdk/typescript/dist"  }}2) Create the app and package.jsonOpen Command prompt in your app folder (e.g. C:\Users\HP\Documents\Programming Folder\Ika-protocol-playground) and run:# go to your app foldercd "C:\Users\HP\Documents\Programming Folder\Ika-protocol-playground"# create package.json quickly (use npm on Windows to avoid pnpm init oddities)npm init -yThis creates a basic package.json. ğŸ‘3) Link the local SDKFrom the same app folder run:# link local SDK from your cloned repo (adjust path if your clone is elsewhere)pnpm add link:../ika/sdk/typescriptExpected outputÂ : + @ika.xyz/sdk 1.0.0 <-Â ..\ika\sdk\typescriptThat makes @ika.xyz/sdk available inside your appâ€™s node_modules as a linked local package.

title: The Great AI Bubble of 2025 Is About to Burst
description:
Insane costs, zero profits, and even Sam Altman is sounding the alarm. The AI gold rush is a lie, and the whole thing is about to get ugly

content: Member-only storyThe Great AI Bubble of 2025 Is About to BurstInsane costs, zero profits, and even Sam Altman is sounding the alarm. The AI gold rush is a lie, and the whole thing is about to get uglyRohit Kumar Thakur5 min readÂ·Just now--SharePress enter or click to view image in full sizeLetâ€™s be real for a second. AI has been everywhere these past few years. Every day, thereâ€™s a new model, a new breakthrough, a new promise that weâ€™re just one step away from AGI.Weâ€™ve all felt it, right? That sense of excitement, the feeling that weâ€™re standing right at the edge of a technological revolution. Iâ€™ve written about it myself.But Iâ€™ve been digging into something lately.. something that feels.. off. Honestly, it worries me. Weâ€™ve already seen this story play out before with Web3, the metaverse, and NFTs. And to me, it sounds a lot like another bubble about to burst.In this article, Iâ€™m going to connect the dots for you, using real data and some shocking warnings from the very people at the top. Iâ€™m not hyping this. Just a cold, hard reality check.First, What the Hell Just Happened?A few days ago, the tech world got a nasty surprise. A massive, sudden sell-off hit AI stocks. Weâ€™re talking big names, the darlings of Silicon Valley, suddenly bleeding value.

title: ChatGPT 5 Under Attack: Can Hackers Downgrade AI Security?
description:
ChatGPT 5 Under Attack: Can Hackers Downgrade AI Security?

Continue reading on Medium Â»
content: Member-only storyChatGPT 5 Under Attack: Can Hackers Downgrade AI Security?Liran Nachman3 min readÂ·Just now--SharePress enter or click to view image in full sizeA newly discovered â€œdowngrade attackâ€ allows hackers to bypass ChatGPT 5â€™s security with simple prompts. This exploit highlights the ongoing challenges in ensuring AI safety and preventing malicious use.ChatGPT 5 Under Attack: Can Hackers Downgrade AI Security?The world of AI is constantly evolving, and with each leap forward comes new challenges and potential vulnerabilities. The latest buzz surrounds a reported â€œdowngrade attackâ€ on ChatGPT 5. But what does this mean, and how worried should we be?Understanding the Downgrade AttackIn cybersecurity, a â€œdowngrade attackâ€ typically involves forcing a system to use an older, less secure protocol or version. Think of it like convincing a sophisticated security system to revert to an older, simpler model thatâ€™s easier to trick. In the context of AI, this could mean manipulating the AI with specific prompts to make it behave like an earlier version, potentially bypassing newer security measures and ethical guidelines.Imagine this: ChatGPT 5 has been trained to avoid generating harmful content. A clever hacker might find a way to phrase prompts that trick the AI into â€œthinkingâ€ itâ€™s an older version, one that hasnâ€™t been fully trained on these safety protocols. Suddenly, the AI might start generating content it shouldnâ€™t, revealing sensitive information, or even assisting in malicious activities. Spooky, right?Why is This Significant?
